message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is primarily focused on computer vision and machine learning techniques for action recognition in infrared videos. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a novel two-stream 3D CNN architecture, which involves training and fine-tuning the model on different datasets, indicating a strong likelihood of belonging to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper introduces a discriminative code layer and loss function, which suggests a possible fit for the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The use of optical flow fields in the proposed approach also indicates a potential fit for the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves experimentation with different fusion schemes, which could potentially fall under the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
